link_desc:
Template and scripts for gathering statistics from an ASSP (Anti Spam SMTP Proxy) server.

Tested with ASSP v 2.6.2

The attached file includes a template, a perl script, and a sample cron job.

The original perl script and template was created by bmcclure and posted to the forum at https://www.zabbix.com/forum/showthread.php?t=16626. I've updated them to work with current (2018) versions of Zabbix and ASSP.

The perl script needs to be placed on a server, and the cron job should be modified to match your environment. The zabbix_sender executable needs to be on the same machine as the perl script. The perl script can be installed on any machine that has network access to both the ASSP and Zabbix servers.

The cron job will need to know (at a minimum)

#) The path to your perl executable.
#) The path to the attached perl script.
#) The DNS name or IP address of your zabbix server (defaults to localhost)
#) The HOST name of your ASSP server as recorded in zabbix.
#) The path to the zabbix_sender executable.

Optional arguments and defaults are:

#) --statsurl http://127.0.0.1:55553
#) --port 10051 #zabbix server port
#) --tmpFile /tmp/zabbix_assp_stats.txt
#) --verbose=0
#) --sinceReset=0
#) --senderLimit = 25 #chunk the stats files into smaller pieces rather than sending all as one "large" file

The template includes 2 triggers with the following (default) conditions:

#) The "Current healthy status" returns a value other than "healthy".
#) The "Current healthy status" value is not updated within 185 seconds.
author: Peter Hinman
